memberdef.argsstring: (wxDC &dc, wxRichTextDrawingContext &context, const wxPoint &pt, long &textPosition, wxRichTextObject **obj, wxRichTextObject **contextObj, int flags=0)
memberdef.name: HitTest

briefdescription.para: Hit-testing: returns a flag indicating hit test details, plus information about position.

detaileddescription.para: contextObj is returned to specify what object position is relevant to, since otherwise there's an ambiguity. @ obj might not be a child of contextObj, since we may be referring to the container itself if we have no hit on a child - for example if we click outside an object.
The function puts the position in textPosition if one is found. pt is in logical units (a zero y position is at the beginning of the buffer).

memberdef.argsstring: (wxDC &dc, wxRichTextDrawingContext &context, long index, wxPoint &pt, int *height, bool forceLineStart)
memberdef.name: FindPosition

briefdescription.para: Calculates the range of the object.

detaileddescription.para: By default, guess that the object is 1 unit long.

memberdef.argsstring: (const wxRichTextRange &range, wxSize &size, int &descent, wxDC &dc, wxRichTextDrawingContext &context, int flags, wxPoint position=wxPoint(0, 0), wxArrayInt *partialExtents=NULL) const
memberdef.name: GetRangeSize

briefdescription.para: Returns the object size for the given range.

detaileddescription.para: Returns false if the range is invalid for this object.

briefdescription.para: Dump object data to the given output stream for debugging.
Invalidates the object at the given range.

detaileddescription.para: With no argument, invalidates the whole object.

briefdescription.para: Returns true if this object is composite.
Returns true if the buffer is empty.
Returns the child object at the given character position.
Appends a child, returning the position.
Inserts the child in front of the given object, or at the beginning.
Removes and optionally deletes the specified child.
Recursively merges all pieces that can be merged.
Moves the object recursively, by adding the offset from old to new.
Objects of this class can contain other objects.
